text: IMHO a smoother achieves that without the misleading aspects of binning a scatterplot though. Or a line or bar chart showing the average value for each bin in a way that doesn't mislead people on the first glance into thinking they're seeing all the data.
author: RAVerBruggen

text: To me the advantage is that it can't be confused with a normal scatterplot. People might not quite get what the shaded area means, but they will know the line shows the general relationship, and they'll know they're not seeing all the data points individually.
author: RAVerBruggen

text: I is what you naturally assume from the line, II definitely looks different with a smoother, III (nice line save one point) isn't going to be a problem with a huge data set with dots all over the place, and with IV at least the CIs will show there's very little data on the right.
